definitions when used herein the following definitions shall apply director refers to the director of the pinellas park parks and recreation division division when used hereinafter is defined as the pinellas park parks and recreation division free speech activities include but are not limited to public speaking performances distribution of printed material displays and signs which areis protected by the first amendment to the united states constitution free speech activities do not include activities for commercial purposes park roads are defined as all surfaced areas ten 10 feet wide or wider designated for vehicular traffic and passing legally defined park or recreational area or any part thereof all other traffic ways either unpaved or narrower than ten 10 feet are classified as work trails bridle paths or simple trails or paths parking area is defined to mean any designated part of any park road drive or special area contiguous thereto that may be set apart for the standing or stationing of any vehicleor operation by the parks and recreation division parks and recreation are defined to mean parks playgrounds recreation fields buildings lakes streams canals and water areas therein and all public service facilities located on or in grounds waters buildings and structures in pinellas park which are under the control of or assigned for upkeep maintenance parks and recreation division property when used hereinafter is defined to cover all areas buildings locations facilities equipment and furnishings described in parks  person shall be understood as employed herein to mean any individual regardless of age or sex or any corporation company association firm copartnership club or society or any association of person or any agent or employee thereof vehicle is defined to mean any wheeled conveyance except a baby carriage or wheel chair for the transportation of persons or materials whether 1 powered or drawn by a motor such as an automobile truck motorcycle or scooter  or 2 animaldrawn such as a carriage wagon or cart  or 3 selfpropelled such as a bicycle or tricycle  or 4 any trailer in tow of any size kind or description exception is made as to any recreational or park transportation service on rails or otherwise where especially authorized by the director of parks and recreation  traffic laws applicable state vehicle laws shall apply in and about all park property and in addition thereto the following rules shall be applicable on roads and driveways within parks a no person driving operating controlling or propelling any vehicle motorized horse drawn or selfpropelled shall use any other than the regularly designated paved or improved park roads or driveways except when authorized or directed to do so by a law enforcement officer or designated city employee b the operator of any vehicle must obey all signs in regard to speed limits danger direction of traffic and other traffic rules specifically applicable in park areas c all law enforcement officers and designated city employees are hereby authorized and instructed to direct traffic whenever and wherever needed in the parks and recreation areas and on the highways streets or roads immediately adjacent thereto all persons shall comply with any lawful order signal or direction of such officer or employee all persons shall observe carefully all traffic signs indicating speed direction caution stopping or parking and all others posted for proper control and to safeguard life and property d no person shall drive a vehicle at a speed greater than is reasonable or prudent having due regard for the surface width and condition of paving and the traffic thereon all vehicles shall give right of way to pedestrians and bicyclists maximum speed shall be fifteen 15 miles per hour excepting at the more congested centers and near park buildings and picnic and play areas and in said last mentioned areas maximum speed shall be determined by the chief of police who shall cause to be erected properly posted signs giving notice thereof all persons shall not exceed the speed limits as posted within the individual parks e where a highway traverses a city park or recreation area and is available for public use at all times said road shall be open to all permitted on any city road or highway but such shall conform to park speed and traffic regulations f no vehicle shall enter any city park except designated park entrance gate no vehicle shall enter any city park until the required fee if any has been paid except those entering on park business  trucks and other vehicles no private or public trucks carts wagons or other vehicles carrying building materials merchandise or other articles of freight or merchandise for sale shall enter any park or recreation area or make use of park roads except traversing the park on roads especially designated for such passage to service adjacent lands not available via other than park roads except on special authorization of the parks and recreation director or in connection with park work and activities exception is made for empty trucks not for hire and used solely at the time for transporting persons to a park for recreational purposes  bicycles tricycles motorcycles and scooters no person shall ride drive or propel any motorcycle scooter or similar vehicle on any but the regular vehicular roads or other paths designated for specific use by such vehicles  parking a no person shall park a vehicle any place on park property other than in the regular designated facilities provided for that particular type of vehicle unless directed otherwise by law enforcement officers or designated city employees who are authorized to designate other areas for parking when conditions so warrant b no person shall park or station any vehicle in any zone designated and marked no parking or otherwise marked for restricted use except briefly for the expeditious loading or unloading of passengers or freight and in no case in excess of five 5 minutes for passengers and ten 10 minutes for freight c no person shall doublepark any vehicle at any time on any road or parkway or parking concourse unless so directed by a law enforcement officer or designated city employee  preservation of property regulation of conduct with respect to protection of park property to prevent damage removal or destruction is necessary to preserve park and recreation areas for the use of future generations a as all property in all parks is city property no person shall willfully mark deface or injure in any way or displace remove or tamper with any park building or building material water lines or other public utilities or parts or appurtenances thereof park signs notices or placards whether temporary or permanent monuments stakes posts or other boundary markers or other structures or equipment facilities or park property or appurtenances whatsoever either real or personal b no person shall dig or remove from any park area any soil rock stones trees shrubs plants seeds flowers fruits or nuts down timber or other wood or materials or make any search excavation by tool equipment metal detector blasting or other means or agency or construct or erect any buildings or structures or whatever kind whether permanent or temporary in character or run or string any public service utility into upon or across such lands except on special written permit from parks and recreation director c trees shrubbery and lawns are property assets of the park no person shall cut carve or injure the bark or break off limbs or branches or mutilate in any way or pick the flowers fruits seeds or nuts of any tree or plant nor shall any person dig in or otherwise disturb the grass areas or in any other way injure or impair the natural beauty or usefulness of any area additionally it is prohibited to pile debris or material of any kind on or about any tree or plant or attach any rope wire or other contrivance to any tree or plant whether temporary or permanent in character or use d no person shall transplant or remove any tree or plant or part thereof or collect or remove flowers except that scientists or students of botany may procure from the director special permission to collect plant specimens e no person except in emergencies shall change any parts repair wash grease or perform other maintenance on a vehicle on any park roadway parkway driveway parking lot or other park property  protection and preservation of wild life hunting and fishing a no unauthorized person shall molest harm frighten kill net trap snare hunt chase shoot or throw or propel by any means missiles at any wildlife creature be it mammal aquatic or marine life bird or reptile roaming free about the park or in captivity in a cage nor shall any unauthorized person remove or possess the young of any wild animal or the nest or eggs of any reptile or bird or to collect remove possess give away sell or offer to sell buy or offer to buy or accept as a gift any specimen dead or alive b no person shall disobey posted notices prohibiting feeding mammals birds reptiles amphibians or fish c no person shall place dump abandon or leave any fish mammal reptile or bird either wild or domestic on park property d commercial fishing or the buying or selling of fish caught in any park waters is strictly forbidden e no person shall fish in any park waters and whether by the use of hook and line seine net trap spear gig or other device except in such waters thereof as are or may be designated by the parks and recreation director for that use and under such regulations and restrictions as have been or may be prescribed by said director f no hunting trapping or pursuit of wildlife by any means or method whatsoever will be permitted on or in any park area by any unauthorized persons    10132011 recreation activities proper use of facilities a while using the parks it is the responsibility of each visitor to conduct his activities in such a manner so as to prevent injury or loss of life to any person b no person shall engage in recreation or other activities other than those prescribed in areas set aside for such purposes c no person shall set up tents shacks or any other temporary shelters or any special vehicle to be used or that could be used for such purpose  such as a house trailer camp trailer camp wagon or the like for the purpose of overnight camping except within such areas if any as may have been provided for such use d no person will loiter in or around any rest room dressing room or bathhouse e no person shall dress or undress except in such bathhouse or structures as may be provided and maintained by the department for that purpose and dressing or undressing in any vehicle toilet rest room or in any park area except as provided above is prohibited f no person shall conduct himself by improper immoral actions or dress or use profane language g the city manager or his designated representative shall publish as appropriate additional rules for the use of city parks and recreation areas  bathing and swimming a no person regardless of age sex or manner of dress shall swim wade or bathe in waters or waterways in any park other than at such places as are posted for such activities either lake pond or pool b no person shall erect or cause to be erected any tent shelter or structure on or in any bathing or wading area in such a manner that a guy wire rope extension brace or support connected or fastened from any such structure to any other structure stake rock or other object is necessary nor shall any other such structure tent or shelter lack an unobstructed view of the interior from at least two 2 sides c no person shall carry transport or cause to be transported any glassware or any other potentially dangerous or sharp objects into any beach bathing wading or swimming pool areas d no person shall frequent any park waters for the purpose of swimming or bathing except between such hours of the day as shall be designated by the division for such purposes for each individual area however swimming and bathing in all areas after dark is forbidden except under controlled conditions e swimming pools may be closed to the public and bathing therein may be prohibited at any time when in the opinion of the parks and recreation division such bathing is dangerous or otherwise inadvisable  boating a no person shall bring or operate any boat canoe raft or other watercraft except toys too small for human occupancy in any park property watercourses lakes canals rock pits ponds other than those so designated for such use of purpose by the parks and recreation director b no person other than a concessionaire licensed by the city council to operate within a city park shall be permitted to rent hire or operate for charge any kind of boat or watercraft whether powered or not on any park waters  picnic areas and use a no person shall build light or cause to be lighted any fire upon the ground or other object in any area except in an approved grill stove fireplace or other suitable container nor shall any person starting a fire leave the area without extinguishing the fire to maintain cleanliness and order as well as to reduce fire hazard each picnic party shall see that its fire is completely extinguished before leaving and that all trash such as boxes papers cans bottles garbage and other refuse is placed in the disposal receptacles where provided if there are no such trash receptacles available then refuse shall be carried away from the park area to be properly disposed of elsewhere b no person will picnic lunch or cook in any area not specifically designated for such usage c no person shall use a grill or other device in such a manner as to burn char mar or blemish any bench table or other object of park property d the parks and recreation director or a designated representative will regulate activities in picnic areas when necessary to prevent congestion and to secure the maximum use for the comfort and convenience of all if the facilities are crowded persons holding picnics in any area building or structure will avoid using same to the exclusion of others for an unreasonable time the determination of what is unreasonable being at the discretion of the parks and recreation director use of the individual fireplaces together with tables and benches follows generally the rule of first come first served  horseback riding no person shall engage in horseback riding in any park or recreation area other than those where provision for such is made by clearly marked bridle paths trails rings and other necessary features and then only upon thoroughly broken and properly restrained animals are ridden with care prevented from grazing straying unattended untethered to any rock tree or shrub and not ridden or led on any park land other than that so designated  domestic animals a dogs and other pets will be excluded from any place where food and drinks are sold b all dogs shall at all times be restrained and on adequate leashes not greater than six 6 feet in length c in compliance with the regulations of the state board of health all pets are excluded from all swimming areas d seeing eye guide dogs and other service animals shall be excluded from these regulations concerning domestic animals and shall be permitted in all park areas and facilities  toy firearms fireworks and explosives a no person shall at any time bring into or have in his possession or discharge anywhere in any park or recreational area any toy firearm air rifle air gun toy cannon slingshot bow and arrow or any toy or instrument that discharges projectiles either by air elastic explosive substance or any other force b no person may bring into or have in his possession or set off or otherwise cause to explode discharge or burn in any park area or on any public lands or highways adjacent thereto any firecrackers torpedoes rockets toy firearms or cannon or other fireworks or explosives of inflammable material or any substance compound mixture or article that in conjunction with any other substance or compound may explode discharge or burn unless in connection with a program sponsored by the parks and recreation division c parents or guardians will be held strictly responsible and accountable for the actions of minors in regard to the prohibitions in the foregoing subsections d nothing contained in this any other part of the ordinances of the city of pinellas park shall be deemed or construed to be in contravention of the states preemption of the regulation of firearms contained at florida statute  79033    101311 refuse and trash no person will deposit or drop or place any refuse including bottles broken glass ashes paper boxes cans dirt rubbish waste garbage tobacco products or containers or foil upon the ground or in or on any other park property parkway or other area operated or maintained by the division except in the receptacles provided for trash disposal  park hours a the parks and recreation director shall establish publish and post as appropriate hours of operation for the facilities under his or her control or supervision b no person shall enter upon any part of any park property which is in an unfinished state or under construction or withheld from general public usage in the interest of public safety health or welfare c no person shall without permission of the parks and recreation director or designated representative enter any park or recreation area at any time other than the established hours of operation  merchandising vending peddling solicitation of alms contributions petitions and fortune telling a no person organizations or firm other than the parks and recreation division will expose or offer for sale rent or trade any article or thing or station or place any stand cart or vehicle for the transportation sale or display of any article of merchandise within the limits of any park or recreation area or on the waters thereof except by written permission of the city manager or designee b no person shall solicit alms or contributions for any purpose whether public or private nor shall any person circulate petitions of any character in any parks or recreation area except by written permission of the city manager or a designated city employee c no person shall tell fortunes or foretell futures for money or any other consideration of value by any means or method whatever within the limits of any park or recreation area or any building pertaining thereto or on any park road within the limits of any park or recreation area  reservation of cityowned or maintained athletic fields permits rules for use of athletic fields a any person or group may reserve the use of any cityowned or maintained athletic field for a specific period of time by obtaining a permit therefore from the city manager or his designee the person or group obtaining a permit shall have priority over all other persons and groups for the use of such athletic facility during the period so reserved such permit shall be in a form prescribed by the city manager or his designee b the city manager or his designee shall promulgate regulations for the issuance of these permits and the use of cityowned or maintained athletic facilities pursuant thereto failure to comply with published rules and regulations shall result in the following action in addition to any other appropriate action which the city may take 1 the first offense shall result in a written warning  2 the second offense shall result in the violator being forbidden to use any such athletic facility for such period as may be determined by the city manager or his designee not to exceed six 6 months c organized recreational league teams may utilize only those cityowned or maintained athletic fields for play or practice as may be designated by the city manager or his designee  advertising publicity and signs a no person shall use any area within the limits of any park or recreation area for the purpose of advertising or calling attention to any article or service for sale or hire nor shall any signs slogans loudspeakers or advertising display of any nature whatever be used for such purposes no person shall place or station within any park or recreation area any vehicle whatsoever displaying any such advertising intent of advertising or used for such purposes herein mentioned b no person shall display distribute post or affix any banner sign handbill pamphlet circular placard or any other printed matter containing commercial advertising within any park area the limits of any park or recreation area except by written permit of the city manager  free speech activities the city council shall have the authority to designate certain parks or recreation areas or portions thereof which will be available for any free speech activities which due to the size of the group or the nature of the activity may interfere with the use and enjoyment or recreation area by the general public a permits for use of a park or recreation area or any portion thereof in the exercise of free speech activities shall be obtained by application to the city manager in accordance with the following 1 a person seeking issuance of a permit hereunder shall file application stating a the name and address of the applicant  b the name and address of the person or organization sponsoring the activity if any  c the day and hours for which the permit is to be issued  d the approximate number of persons who may be attending the activity  e the park or recreation area or portion thereof for which the permit is to be issued  and f variances required from park rules and regulations if any 2 standards for issuance of a permit shall include the following findings a that the proposed activity or use of the park will not unreasonably interfere with or detract from the general publics enjoyment of the park or recreation area b that the proposed activity and use will not unreasonably interfere or detract from the promotion of public health safety welfare and recreation c that the proposed activity or uses that are reasonably anticipated will not include violence crime or disorderly conduct d that the proposed activity will not entail extraordinary or burdensome expense or police operation by the city e that the park or recreation area or portion thereof desired has not been reserved for other use on the date and hour requested in the application f if the permit is to be issued only to use one 1 of the parks and recreation areas which city council has designated under subsection a above that the size of the group or the nature of the activity may unreasonably interfere with the use and enjoyment of the park or recreation area by the general public b within ten 10 days after receipt of the application the city manager shall inform an applicant in writing of the decision to grant or deny a permit  in the event of a denial the notification shall include the reason for such denial based on standards listed in subsection b2 above c any aggrieved person shall have the right to appeal to city council by filing written notice thereof with the city clerk within ten 10 working days of the date of the notification by the city manager the city council shall within ten 10 working days from the filing of the appeal with the city clerk or at its first regularly scheduled meeting after the filing of the appeal whichever is later decide whether or not to grant the permit city council shall apply the same standards listed in subsection b2 above the decision by city council shall be final d a permitee shall be bound by all applicable park rules and all applicable city ordinances fully as though same were inserted in such permits e the city manager shall have the authority to revoke a permit upon a finding of violation of any rule or ordinance or upon good shown cause the permit holder may appeal such revocation to the city council in accordance with the procedure for appealing a permit denial and the city council shall have the same powers as in the case of a permit denial  use and sale of alcohol and use of narcotics a no individual under the influence of alcohol drugs or narcotics will be permitted entry to park areas and if discovered therein will be subject to immediate expulsion b the sale or consumption of alcoholic beverages shall not be permitted in any city park except by written permission of the city manager or a designated city employee for the purposes of this alcoholic beverages shall mean distilled spirits and all beverages containing onehalf  of one 1 percent or more alcohol by volume the sale or consumption of illegal drugs or narcotics of any form is prohibited in any city park or recreation area  special permits other recreational activities may be allowed by special permit if authorized by the city manager  enforcement of regulations and permits all rules and regulations and permits contained in this document are enforceable by employees  insurance requirements any group or person who makes application for a permitted activity special event or other activities set forth in this may be required prior to the commencement of any activity or issuance of any permit to submit evidence of liability insurance covering injuries to members of the general public and indemnifying the city and its officers and employees for liability arising out of such permitted activities in such amounts as may be from time to time determined by the risk management director in consultation with the parks and recreation director  penalties any person or persons who commit the offense of violating any of the provisions of this be punished by a fine in the sum not to exceed five hundred dollars $50000 or by imprisonment in the county jail for a period not to exceed sixty 60 days or both fine and imprisonment  severability it is declared to be the intent of the city council of pinellas park that if any subsection sentence clause phrase or provision of this held invalid or unconstitutional such invalidity or unconstitutionality shall not be so construed as to render invalid or unconstitutional the remaining provisions of this  article xi  legal defense fund purpose the purpose of enacting an establish a fund for reimbursing employees of the city of pinellas park for attorneys fees expended in the successful defense of criminal prosecution arising from action taken in the course of performing their official duties and while in the scope of their employment is a to guarantee that the city be able to attract hire and retain qualified employees agents and officials  that providing a fund for reimbursement of such legal fees is necessary to insure the attraction and retention of qualified individuals to serve as employees agents or officials of the city of pinellas park  that to attract employees of the highest quality it is necessary to provide them with assurances that should they wrongfully be subject to criminal prosecution arising from action taken while performing their official duties and furthering the business of the citizens of pinellas park that they will be reimbursed by the city for actions taken in good faith in its behalf  b to insure fundamental fairness to all city employees agents and officers  that the employee agent or official having been found innocent of wrongdoing or having been discharged from prosecution has been vindicated of any wrongdoing and it is unfair and inequitable that such employee agent or official should have to bear the heavy financial burden of attorneys fees incurred while acting in his official capacity in furtherance of the business of the citizens of pinellas park and while in the scope of his employment  c to insure freedom of action  that reimbursement of such attorneys fees is necessary to insure freedom of action by city employees agents or officials  that such reimbursement will allow each employee agent or official to more fully perform his lawful duties since he need not fear consequences arising from the lawful exercise of such duties  d to maintain the good image and integrity of the city of pinellas park the citys image and integrity are directly benefited by the vindication of any employee agent or official from wrongdoing arising from action taken while acting in the course of his employment and while in furtherance of his official duties and the business of pinellas park vindication of city employees agents or officers is a subject of great interest to the city and reimbursement of such attorneys fees is an incentive to city employees agents or officers to successfully defend prosecution wrongfully brought against them  limitations reimbursement to a city employee agent or official for attorneys fees incurred in successfully defending criminal prosecution arising out of his official duties is subject to all of the following requirements a the city employee agent or official must have been subjected to criminal prosecution from action taken by him in his performance and furtherance of official city business or duties b the city employee agent or official must have been acting at the time of such action directly in the scope of his employment and within the scope of his authority c the city employee agent or official must have acted in good faith d the city employee agent or official must have been found innocent of wrongdoing or the case against him must have been dismissed or otherwise discharged in order for reimbursement to be allowed e the amount of reimbursement shall be for all reasonable attorneys fees incurred in defending such prosecution if the council by majority vote shall determine that such attorneys fees are unreasonable then the council shall award an amount which it determines to be reasonable f reimbursement of attorneys fees out of the fund herein created shall not be made if payment of such attorneys fees is otherwise payable under an insurance policy providing for such reimbursement or payment  reimbursement of attorneys fees for criminal defense any city employee agent or official who successfully defends criminal prosecution arising out of the performance of his official duties and in the scope of his employment and authority may present a petition and four 4 additional copies thereof to the city council at a regular council meeting requesting the reimbursement of such attorneys fees and shall present with such petition a sworn affidavit itemizing and detailing all fees paid to the attorney and swearing that such fees paid to the attorney are the true and complete fees paid or agreed to be paid and that there exists no separate additional or secret agreement or contingencies between such city employee agent or official and his attorney concerning payment of fees the petition shall be considered by each councilman and voting thereon shall take place at the next regular meeting if a majority of the city council shall determine that such attorneys fees were incurred defending a criminal prosecution arising out of his official duties and in furtherance of city business and that such employee agent or official was acting in the scope of his authority and employment and otherwise meets the requirements of this article then such employee agent or official shall be reimbursed for all such reasonable attorneys fees if the council by majority vote shall determine that such attorneys fees are unreasonable then the council shall award an amount which it determines to be reasonable  article xii  code enforcement board intent the intent of this to create a local government board and special magistrates in order to promote protect and improve the health safety and welfare of the citizens of the city of pinellas park by providing for an equitable expeditious effective and inexpensive method of enforcing any of the codes or ordinances in force in the city of pinellas park it is the intention that this supplement the provisions of fs ch 162 which shall govern the process and procedures for the board and special magistrate proceedings        3222007   182009 definitions the following definitions are applicable to this have the following meanings board the city of pinellas park municipal board community compliance specialists any employee or authorized agent of the city of pinellas park so designated by the city manager to enforce any of the codes or ordinances in force in the city of pinellas park repeat violation a violation of a provision of the city of pinellas parks ordinances by a person or entity who has previously been found board special magistrate or any other quasijudicial or judicial process to have violated the same provision within five 5 years prior to the violation notwithstanding the violations occurred at different locations special magistrate formerly special master one 1 or more individuals designated by city council in addition to the board to enforce any of the codes or ordinances in force in the city of pinellas park              182009   6222017 composition appointment  terms of members  residency requirements  removal and vacancies a the board shall consist of seven 7 members each to be appointed by a majority of the entire membership of city council of the city of pinellas park florida for a term of three 3 years the initial appointments to the board shall be as follows 1 two 2 members appointed for a term of one 1 year  2 three 3 members appointed for a term of two 2 years  3 two 2 members appointed for a term of three 3 years thereafter all appointments shall be made for a term three 3 years one 1 or more special magistrates may be appointed by a majority of the entire membership of the city council of the city of pinellas park florida for a term of three 3 years b any board member or special magistrate may be reappointed upon approval by a majority of the entire membership of the city council c appointments to fill vacancies shall be for the unexpired term of office d members of the board shall be residents of the city of pinellas park florida at the time of their appointment and throughout the term of office any member who is no longer a resident of the city of pinellas park shall be automatically removed and that vacancy filled as provided herein special magistrates need not be residents of the city of pinellas park but preference for qualified city residents may be given in the appointment of special magistrates e if any board member fails to attend two 2 successive hearings without cause and without prior approval of the chairman of the board the board shall declare the members office vacant and the vacancy filled as provided herein if any special magistrate fails to attend two 2 successive hearings for which the special magistrate was scheduled to preside without cause and without prior approval of the city manager or hisher designee then the city council shall declare the special magistrates office vacant and the vacancy filled as provided herein f appointments shall be made consistent with the charter of the city of pinellas park florida on the basis of demonstrated experience or interest in the subject matter jurisdiction of the board in the sole discretion of the city council the membership of the board shall whenever possible consist of an architect businessperson engineer general contractor subcontractor and a realtor g board members and special magistrates may be removed for cause by the city council after public hearing vacancies by such removal shall be filled as provided herein              182009 oath of office each member of the board and each special magistrate upon appointment shall before entering upon discharge of his or her duties of office take an oath of office      182009 organization and compensation of board  conduct at hearings  legal counsel to the board a organization of board 1 the members of the board shall elect a chairman from among its members who shall be a voting member the ex officio duties of the chairman will include serving as alternate special magistrate 2 the presence of four 4 or more members for compliance with the applicable code and with orders issued in the code enforcement proceedings 4 file a notice with the code enforcement official of the transfer of the property with the identity and address of the new owner and copies of the disclosures made to the new owner within 5 days after the date of the transfer a failure to make the disclosures described in this section before the transfer creates a rebuttable presumption of fraud if the property is transferred before the hearing the proceeding shall not be dismissed but the new owner shall be provided a reasonable period of time to correct the violation before the hearing is held              182009 administrative fines  liens a the board and a special magistrate as the case may be upon notification by the community accounts and accounting procedure of the city shall be adequate to record all cash receipts and disbursements all revenue accrued and liabilities incurred and all transactions affecting the charter1977 fiscal year the fiscal year of the city shall begin on the first day of october and shall end on the last day of september of each calendar year such fiscal year shall also constitute the budget and accounting year as used in this the term budget year shall mean the fiscal year for which any particular budget is adopted and in which it is administered   brought forth from former city charter1977 annual budget annually within the period prescribed by the city manager the directors and chiefs of departments and divisions shall prepare and submit to the city manager detailed information and estimates of the expenditures and revenues of their respective departments and divisions for the ensuing year the city manager from such information and estimates shall compile revise and submit to the city council on or before the second regular meeting in august of each year a budget presenting a financial plan for conducting the affairs of the city for the ensuing fiscal year the budget shall include the following information a detailed estimates of the expense of conducting each department and office of the city for the ensuing fiscal year b expenditures for corresponding items for the current year and last preceding fiscal year with reasons for increases and decreases recommended as compared with appropriations for the current year c the value of supplies and materials on hand at the date of the preparation of the estimates d the amount of the total and net debt of the city together with a schedule of maturities of bond issues e a statement of the total probable income of the city from taxes for the period covered by the estimate f an itemization of anticipated revenue from other sources g the amount required for interest on the city debt for sinking funds and for maturing bonds h such other information as may be required by the council   brought forth from former city charter1977 annual appropriation ordinance upon receipt of the budget estimate the council shall review the same and shall prepare an appropriation using the city managers estimate as a basis a the council shall have power to increase or decrease the amount recommended for any department division or office by items only the council shall provide for printing a reasonable number of copies of the budget estimate for distribution to those citizens who wish same and provision shall be made for public hearings on the proposed appropriation the council sitting as a committee of the whole the appropriation be passed on or before the first regular meeting in september each year b before the annual appropriation been passed the council may make appropriations for the current expenses of the city chargeable to the appropriations of the year when passed to any amount sufficient to cover the necessary expense of the various departments divisions and offices until the annual appropriation in force no other liabilities shall be incurred by any officer or employee of the city except in accordance with the provisions of the annual appropriation c upon the request of the city manager the council may transfer any part of any unencumbered balance of an appropriation to a purpose or object for which the appropriation for the current year has been deemed insufficient or may authorize a transfer to be made between items appropriated between departments divisions or offices the city manager may authorize a transfer for line items to be made within departments divisions or offices d any accruing revenue of the city not appropriated as hereinbefore provided and the balance at any time remaining after the purposes of an appropriation shall have been satisfied or abandoned may from time to time be appropriated by the council to such uses as will not conflict with any uses for which specifically such revenue accrued e no money shall be drawn from the treasury of the city nor shall any obligation for the expenditures of money be incurred except pursuant to appropriations made by the council at the close of each fiscal year the unencumbered balance of each appropriation shall revert to the fund from which it was appropriated and shall be subject to future appropriation  but appropriations may be made in furtherance of improvements or other objects or works of the city which will not be completed within the current year f no liability shall be enforceable against the city upon any contract nor supported by the previous appropriation nor shall the city be liable for any service material or supplies furnished to the city or to any department division or office thereof the financial requirements of which are to be met out of the proceeds of taxes or any other funds controlled by the council unless the council shall previously have made an appropriation therefor in the event contracts are made to extend over a period of longer than one 1 year and which are to be met from current receipts of the city it shall be lawful for the council to make appropriations sufficient to answer the requirements of any such contracts for only one 1 year and the contract shall be legal and binding upon the city notwithstanding the fact that no appropriation has been made for the ensuing years over which it is to be operative and it shall be the duty of the council to make appropriations from year to year as required for the purpose of such contracts the obligations of the city under such contracts shall not be considered to be a part of the indebtedness of the city g accounts shall be kept for each specific item of appropriation made by the council and every warrant on the treasury shall state specifically against which of such items the warrant is drawn each account shall show in detail the appropriations made thereto by the council the amount drawn thereon the unpaid obligations charged against it h no claims against the city shall be paid except by means of a warrant on the treasury issued by the director of finance or his deputy and countersigned by the mayor or vicemayor the director of finance shall examine all payrolls bills purchase orders and other claims and demands against the city and shall issue no warrant for payment unless he finds the claim is in proper form correctly computed and duly certified and that it is justly and legally due and payable that an appropriation has been made therefor which has not been exhausted or that the payment has been otherwise legally authorized  and that there is money in the city treasury to make payment all purchase orders must be approved by the city manager prior to the payment therefor the director of finance may require any claimant to make oath to the validity of a claim he may investigate any claim and for that purpose may examine witnesses under oath and if he finds a claim to be fraudulent erroneous or otherwise invalid he shall not issue a warrant therefor if the director of finance issues a warrant on the treasury for any item for which no appropriation has been made or for the payment of which there is not sufficient money in the proper fund or which for any other cause should not be approved he and his sureties shall be individually procedures for responses to and settlements for claims filed under the bert j harris jr private property rights protection act the private property rights protection act and the florida land use and environmental dispute resolution act the dispute resolution act procedures for responses to and settlements of claims filed under the private property rights act a the claimant shall file his written claim together with the required appraisal with the city manager or his designee immediately upon receipt of the claim and appraisal the city manager shall transmit copies thereof to all members of city council the city attorney the risk management director all parties to any administrative action which gave rise to the claim and the owners of real property contiguous to the claimants property at the addresses listed on the most recent county tax rolls within fifteen 15 days from receipt of the claim the city manager or his designee shall after consultation with the city attorney report the claim in writing to the department of legal affairs and shall provide the department with the name address and telephone number of the employee of the city from whom additional information may be obtained about the claim during the pendency of the claim and any subsequent judicial action b as soon as is practicable after the service of the claim upon the city manager or his designee the city attorney and the city manager shall discuss the claim with city council at an appropriate lawfully called meeting thereafter the city attorney and city manager shall to the extent they deem appropriate engage in preliminary settlement negotiations with the claimant or his or her legal counsel with a view toward formulating a proposed settlement agreement to be presented to city council for consideration if requested by city council or if the city attorney and city manager deem it advisable they may have additional discussions regarding the preliminary settlement negotiations with city council at appropriate subsequent lawfully called meetings c as a goal and not as a mandatory time requirement the city attorney and city manager shall attempt to conclude the preliminary settlement negotiations and present a proposed settlement agreement to city council for its consideration within one hundred twenty 120 days after service of the claim upon the city manager or his designee d city council shall thereafter consider the proposed settlement agreement at the conclusion of its discussions regarding the proposed settlement agreement city council shall adopt an approved proposed settlement agreement and shall authorize the city attorney to transmit the approved proposed settlement agreement to the claimant or to his or her legal counsel the approved proposed settlement agreement shall to the extent deemed appropriate by city council offer to effectuate 1 an adjustment of land development or permit standards or other provisions controlling development or use of land  2 any increases or modifications in the density or use of areas of development  3 the transfer of development rights  4 land swap or exchanges  5 mitigation including payments in lieu of onsite mitigation  6 location on the least sensitive portion of the property  7 conditioning the amount of development or use permitted  8 a requirement that issues by addressed on a more comprehensive basis than a single proposed use or development  9 issuance of the development order a variance conditional use or other extraordinary relief  10 purchase of the real property or an interest therein by the city andor any other governmental or nongovernmental third party  11 no changes to the action of the city notwithstanding any other provisions of the ordinances to the contrary city council shall have the sole authority for the approval of any proposed settlement agreement without any action by any other board or commission of the city in the absence of a specific requirement by city council that a proposed settlement agreement be referred to any other board or commission of the city for review and input the proposed settlement agreement shall not be so referred city council shall have full authority without any action by any other board or commission of the city to enter into appropriate development agreements issue variances approve special exceptions grant extraordinary relief and take any all further action as may be necessary to effectuate any such proposed settlement agreement including those which would have the effect of a modification variance or a special exception to the application of a policy resolution or ordinance as it would otherwise apply to the subject real property the proposed settlement agreement shall protect the public interest served by the regulations at issue and be the appropriate relief necessary to prevent the citys regulatory effort from inordinately burdening the subject real property e upon receipt of authorization from city council the city attorney shall transmit the proposed settlement agreement to the claimant or to his or her legal counsel f the city attorney shall thereafter notify city council as to whether the claimant has accepted or rejected the proposed settlement agreement 1 if the claimant accepts the proposed settlement agreement then the matter shall be returned to city council for any necessary final action required to effectuate the same if any such proposed settlement agreement accepted by the claimant which effectively contravenes the application of a statute as it would otherwise apply to the affected property the city attorney shall jointly with the claimant file an action in the circuit court for pinellas county florida for approval by that court to ensure that the relief granted protects the public interest served by the relevant statute and is the appropriate relief necessary to prevent the citys regulatory effort from inordinately burdening the real property in question 2 if the claimant rejects the citys proposed settlement agreement then the city manager shall after consultation with the city attorney issue a written ripeness decision identifying the allowable uses for the property in question to confirm what the claimant can and cannot do with the subject property g should the claimant reject the citys ripeness decision as well as the proposed settlement agreement and file a claim for compensation in the circuit court for pinellas county florida the claimant shall contemporaneously serve a copy thereof upon the city manager or his designee immediately upon the service of such claim the city manager or his designee shall provide copies thereof to the city attorney and to the risk management director h within fifteen 15 days after the execution of any settlement or the issuance of any judgment the city manager or his designee shall after consultation with the city attorney provide a copy of the settlement or judgment to the department of legal affairs  procedures for responses to and settlement of claims filed under the dispute resolution act a the claimant shall file his written claim with the city manager or his designee immediately upon receipt of the claim the city manager shall transmit copies thereof to all members of city council the city attorney and the risk management director b within ten 10 days from the service of the claim upon the city manager or his designee the city attorney shall forward the request for relief filed by the claimant to the special master who is mutually agreed upon by the claimant or his or her legal counsel and the city attorney additionally within the same timeframe the city manager or his designee shall serve a copy of the request for relief by united states mail or by hand delivery to 1 owners of real property contiguous to the claimants property at the address on the latest county tax rolls  and 2 any substantially affected party who submitted oral or written testimony sworn or unsworn of a substantive nature which stated with particularity objections to or support for any development order at issue or any enforcement action at issue however such notice under this subparagraph 2 is required only if that party indicated a desire to receive notice of any subsequent special master proceedings occurring on the development order or enforcement action the city shall maintain in its files relating to development orders and enforcement actions mailing lists of persons who have presented oral or written testimony sworn or unsworn and who have requested notice all hearing notices shall contain a statement that only those persons who have presented oral or written testimony with respect to a development order or enforcement action and who have requested notice will be given notice of any subsequent special master proceedings in a claim initiated under the dispute resolution act c within fifteen 15 days of service of the claim on the city manager or his designee the city attorney after consultation with the city council at an appropriate lawfully called meeting or meetings shall file a response delineating the citys position regarding the claimants allegations and the public purpose of the regulations on which the development order is based with the special master and copy thereof upon the claimant or his or her legal counsel d the city attorney shall represent the city in proceedings before the special masters unless the citys insurance carrier has retained legal counsel to represent the city in such proceedings e upon receipt of the special masters decision the city attorney shall advise city council and the city manager of the same if the special master finds that a development order at issue is unreasonable or unfairly burdens the use of the claimants property and the special master makes a recommendation then within fortyfive 45 days after the city attorneys receipt of the special masters recommendation the city and any other governmental entities participating in the proceeding shall consult among themselves and city council shall 1 accept the recommendation of the special master as submitted and proceed to implement it by development agreement when appropriate or by other method  or 2 modify the recommendation as submitted by the special master and proceed to implement the same by development agreement when appropriate or by other method  or 3 reject the recommendation as submitted by the special master notwithstanding any other provisions of the ordinances to the contrary city council shall have the sole authority to take any of the above described actions regarding the special masters recommendation without any action by any other board or commission of the city in the absence of a specific requirement by city council that a special masters recommendation be referred to any other board or commission for the city for review and input the same shall not be so referred city council shall have full authority without any action by any other board or commission of the city to reject such recommendation or to approve development orders and take any and all further action as may be necessary to effectuate any such recommendations as submitted or as modified f if the city accepts the special masters recommendation or modifies it and the owner rejects the acceptance or modification or if the city rejects the special masters recommendation then the city manager shall after consultation with the city attorney issue a written response decision within thirty 30 days therefrom that describes as specifically as possible the use or uses available to the subject property g the city manager shall upon request from the city attorney authorize payment of the citys portion of the reasonable special master fees and expenses including the costs of providing notice and effecting service of the request for relief from the appropriate city accounts  chapter propelled solely by human power or any moped propelled by a pedalactivated helper motor with a manufacturers certified maximum rating of 1 brake horsepower upon which any person may ride having two 2 tandem wheels and including any device generally recognized as a bicycle though equipped with two 2 front or two 2 rear wheels the term does not include such a vehicle with a seat height of no more than twentyfive 25 inches from the ground when the seat is adjusted to its highest position or a scooter or similar device crosswalk that part of a roadway at an intersection included within the connections of the lateral lines of the sidewalks on opposite sides of the highway measured from the curbs or in the absence of curbs from the edges of the traversable roadway private road or driveway any privately owned way or place used for vehicular travel by the owner and those having express or implied permission from the owner but not by other persons rightofway the right of one 1 vehicle or pedestrian to proceed in a lawful manner in preference to another vehicle or pedestrian approaching under such circumstances of direction speed and proximity as to give rise to danger of collision unless one grants precedence to the other roadway that portion of a highway improved designed or ordinarily used for vehicular travel exclusive of the berm or shoulder in the event a highway includes two 2 or more separate roadways the term roadway as used herein refers to any such roadway separately but not to all such roadways collectively sidewalk that portion of a street between the curbline or the lateral line of a roadway and the adjacent property lines intended for use by pedestrians  bicycle regulations the bicycle regulations of the city of pinellas park florida are in accordance with fs ch  except that mopeds shall not be propelled except by human power upon any public sidewalk within the city the following are the bicycle regulations of the city of pinellas park florida a every person propelling a vehicle by human power has all of the rights and all of the duties applicable to the driver of any other vehicle under this except as to special regulations in this except as to provisions of this by their nature can have no application b a person operating a bicycle may not ride other than upon or astride a permanent and regular seat attached thereto c no bicycle may be used to carry more persons at one time than the number for which it is designed or equipped except that an adult rider may carry a child securely attached to his person in a backpack or sling d no person riding upon any bicycle coaster roller skates skateboard sled or toy vehicle may attach the same or himself to any vehicle upon a roadway this not prohibit attaching a bicycle trailer or bicycle semitrailer to a bicycle if that trailer or semitrailer has been designed for such attachment and solely for carrying cargo e any person operating a bicycle upon a roadway at less than the normal speed of traffic at the time and place and under the conditions then existing shall ride as close as practicable to the righthand curb or edge of the roadway except under any of the following situations 1 when overtaking and passing another bicycle or vehicle proceeding in the same direction 2 when preparing for a left turn at an intersection or into a private road or driveway 3 when reasonably necessary to avoid any condition including but not limited to a fixed or moving object parked or moving vehicle bicycle pedestrian animal surface hazard or substandard width lane that makes it unsafe to continue along the righthand curb or edge for the purposes of this a substandard width lane is a lane that is too narrow for a bicycle and another vehicle to travel safely side by side within the lane f any person operating a bicycle upon a oneway highway with two 2 or more marked traffic lanes may ride as near the lefthand curb or edge of such roadway as practicable g persons riding bicycles upon a roadway may not ride more than two 2 abreast except on paths or parts of roadways set aside for the exclusive use of bicycles persons riding two 2 abreast may not impede traffic when traveling at less than the normal speed of traffic at the time and place and under the conditions then existing and shall ride within a single lane h any person operating a bicycle shall keep at least one 1 hand upon the handlebars i every bicycle in use between sunset and sunrise shall be equipped with a lamp on the front exhibiting a white light visible from a distance of at least five hundred 500 feet to the front and a lamp on the rear exhibiting a red light visible from a distance of six hundred 600 feet to the rear except that a red reflector meeting the requirements of this be used in lieu of the red light a bicycle or its rider may be equipped with lights or reflectors in addition to those required by this j no parent of any minor child and no guardian of any minor ward may authorize or knowingly permit any such minor child or ward to violate any of the provisions of this k a person propelling a bicycle by human power upon and along a sidewalk or across a roadway upon and along a crosswalk has all the rights and duties applicable to a pedestrian under the same circumstances l a person propelling a bicycle by human power upon and along a sidewalk or across a roadway upon and along a crosswalk shall yield the rightofway to any pedestrian and shall give an audible signal before overtaking and passing such pedestrian m no person upon roller skates skateboard or riding in or by means of any coaster toy vehicle or similar device may go upon any roadway except while crossing a street on a crosswalk  and when so crossing such person shall be granted all rights and shall be subject to all of the duties applicable to pedestrians n this not apply upon any street while set aside as a play street authorized herein or designated by state county or city authority o no person under fifteen 15 years of age may operate a moped p no moped may be propelled except by human power upon any public sidewalk within the city of pinellas park florida  compliance with traffic laws control signals lights and signs required every person who drives or propels any bicycle upon any street or highway of the city shall comply with all signal lights stop signs and other trafficcontrol devices or signals and shall be subject to and shall comply with all the traffic laws applicable to the driver of any vehicle except such provisions of the traffic laws which by their very nature can have no application to bicycles    operation of bicycles upon sidewalks in designated areas prohibited the city manager may upon a finding that the operation of bicycles upon public sidewalks within a particular area constitutes a public safety hazard prohibit the operation of bicycles upon the public sidewalks within such area the city manager shall file a written order with the city clerk and with the police department describing the designated area and stating that the operation of bicycles upon the public sidewalks within such area is prohibited additionally the city manager shall cause appropriate official signage to be erected at one 1 or more places within the designated area to notify the public that the operation of bicycles upon public sidewalks therein definitions 1 hazardous waste means solid waste or a combination of solid wastes which because of its quantity concentration or physical chemical or infectious characteristics may cause or significantly contribute to an increase in mortality or an increase in serious irreversible or incapacitating reversible illness or may pose a substantial present or potential hazard to human health or the environment when improperly transported disposed of stored treated or otherwise managed 2 hazardous waste facility means any building site structure or equipment at or by which hazardous waste is disposed of stored treated or transported 3 disposal means the discharge deposit injection dumping spilling leaking or placing of any hazardous waste into or upon any land or water so that such hazardous waste or any constituent thereof may enter other lands or may be emitted into the air or discharged into any waters including groundwaters or otherwise enter the environment 4 storage means the containment or holding of a hazardous waste either on a temporary basis or for a period of years in such a manner as not to constitute disposal of such hazardous waste 5 treatment means any method technique or process including neutralization designed to change the physical chemical or biological character or composition of any hazardous waste so as to neutralize it or render it nonhazardous safe for transport amenable to recovery amenable to storage or disposal or reduced in volume or concentration the term includes any activity or processing designed to change the physical form or chemical composition of hazardous waste so as to render it nonhazardous 6 transport or transfer means the movement of hazardous waste from the point of generation or point of entry into the city of pinellas park to any offsite intermediate points and to the point of offsite ultimate disposal storage treatment or exit from the city b a three 3 percent tax is hereby assessed imposed and levied on the annual gross receipts of all privately owned permitted commercial hazardous waste transfer storage treatment or disposal facilities within the corporate limits of the city of pinellas park the tax is payable annually on or before july 1 by the owner of the facility to the citys fiscal officer c the owner or operator of each privately owned permitted commercial hazardous waste transfer storage treatment or disposal facility shall on or before january 25 of each year file with the citys chief fiscal officer a certified notarized statement the statement shall indicate the gross receipts from all charges imposed during the preceding calendar year for the storage treatment transfer or disposal of hazardous waste at the facility d all monies received pursuant to this shall be appropriated and used to pay for 1 the costs of collecting the tax  2 any local inspection costs incurred by the city to insure that the facilities are properly operated and in accordance with state and local law and any rules adopted pursuant thereto  3 additional security costs incurred as a result of the facilities including but not limited to monitoring fire protection police protection and support vehicles  4 hazardous waste contingency planning implementation including but not limited to the citys hazardous materials response team and its attendant personnel operating expenses equipment and vehicles  5 road construction or repair costs for public roads adjacent to and within one thousand 1000 feet of any facility  and 6 any other costs incurred by the city of pinellas park as a result of documentation by june 1 of any given year shall constitute a waiver of the additional exemption privilege for that year  economic development incentives enactment authority of the constitution of the state of florida and fs   empower the city to grant economic development ad valorem tax exemptions to new businesses and expansions of existing businesses after electors of the city authorized such exemptions in a referendum held on  the electors of the city of pinellas park authorized the city to grant economic development ad valorem tax exemptions  5262016 findings of fact a it is a recognized function of local government to promote economic development within its jurisdiction by providing financial incentives that will encourage new businesses to relocate within its jurisdiction and existing businesses to expand creating employment opportunities that will benefit the entire community b the current economic climate has resulted in a high unemployment rate in the city of pinellas park impacting the quality of life for the citys citizens and the sustainability of local businesses c the city council of the city of pinellas park the council desires to offer economic development ad valorem tax exemptions to new businesses relocating to the city of pinellas park and to businesses already situated in the city of pinellas park that are expanding in order to foster economic growth and increased employment d in order to ensure that applications for an economic development ad valorem tax exemption are considered in a nonarbitrary and nondiscriminatory manner it is necessary to establish guidelines that further the councils economic development strategic plan to assist the council in making its determinations e applications for an economic development ad valorem tax exemption shall be considered by the council in its legislative capacity on a casebycase basis after considering the property appraisers report and the review criteria f no precedent shall be implied or inferred by the granting of an exemption to a new or expanding business g on  the council approved resolution no 1527 calling for a special referendum seeking authorization to grant economic development ad valorem tax exemptions to qualifying businesses the referendum passed on   5262016 definitions the following words phrases and terms shall have the same meanings attributed to which is the total sales of the taxpayer everywhere during the taxable year or period  5262016 establishment of economic development ad valorem tax exemption there is herein established an economic development ad valorem tax exemption hereinafter the exemption for ad valorem taxes levied by the city the exemption is a local option tax incentive for a qualifying new business or expansion to an existing business which may be granted or refused at the sole discretion of the council a the exemption shall not accrue to improvements to real property made by or for the use of a qualifying new business or expansion to an existing business when such improvements have been included on the tax rolls prior to the effective date of the ordinance specifically granting a business an exemption b at the discretion of the council the exemption may be granted for up to seventyfive 75 percent of the assessed value of all improvements to the real property made by or for the use of a qualifying new business and of all tangible personal property of such new business or up to seventyfive 75 percent of the assessed value of all added improvements to real property made to facilitate the qualifying expansion of an existing business and of the net increase in all tangible personal property acquired to facilitate such expansion of an existing business provided that the improvements to real property are made or the tangible personal property is added or increased on or after the day the ordinance granting the exemption is adopted property acquired to replace existing property shall not be considered to facilitate a business expansion c no exemption shall be granted for the land upon which a new business or expansion of an existing business is to be located d any exemption granted for a new business or expansion of an existing business is nontransferable between businesses  provided however if the only change to the business is one of ownership and all other provisions of the original application remain in effect the exemption may be transferred subject to compliance with e taxes applicable the exemption shall apply only to taxes levied by the city the exemption shall not apply to taxes levied by the county school district or water management district or to taxes levied for the payment of bonds or taxes authorized by a vote of the electors pursuant to b or 12 of the florida constitution or any other taxes levied by any other entity  5262016 application for exemption a application any eligible person firm partnership or corporation which desires an economic circulation means a newspaper printed in the language most commonly spoken in the city and which is readily available for purchase by all inhabitants in the city but does not include a newspaper distribute advertising nonpartisan or nonpartisan office means an office for which a candidate is prohibited from campaigning or qualifying as a candidate for election based on political party oath to that effect the candidates name shall then not be printed on the ballot or in the event the ballots have been printed the name shall be removed if in the opinion of the city clerk time permits without disrupting the administration of the election b in the event any qualified candidate dies withdraws or is removed from the ballot following the end of the filing period and in the event such action leaves fewer than two 2 candidates for that office then the filing period for that particular office shall immediately reopen and additional qualification papers shall be available for that particular office in the office of the city clerk until  noon fourteen 14 days subsequent to the death withdrawal or removal from the ballot of the original candidate the city council shall hold a special meeting within the first seven 7 days of such additional filing period for the purpose of such additional filing period for the purpose of announcing a vacancy in the candidacy announcing the additional filing period and taking any action that may be necessary herein to reschedule the election for that particular office in the event the closing date of the additional filing period is less than twenty 20 days before the date of the schedule election the city council shall schedule a special election for that particular office which election shall be held at least twenty 20 days but not more than thirtyfive 35 days subsequent to the last day of the additional filing period c a candidate withdrawing after having qualified and paid the qualification fee shall not receive a refund of the qualifying fee d a vote cast for a candidate who has withdrawn shall not be canvassed or certified as a valid vote    candidates name the name of a candidate shall be printed on the ballot in the same form as the name appears on the candidates loyalty oath shortened versions or nicknames may be used if so indicated no title or evidence of incumbency shall be printed pursuant to city charter candidates for mayor shall be grouped at the top of the ballot candidates for other seats on the city council shall be grouped according to the seat number for which they are candidates within those groups names shall be placed in alphabetical order  article iii  issue elections calling of election except as otherwise provided by state law or city charter an issue election may be called by the city council upon approval of a resolution to that effect whenever possible the issue election shall be held in conjunction with a regular state county or city election  applicable election laws except as otherwise provided by state law an issue election shall be conducted pursuant to the provisions of city charter and this  ballot language a city council shall in the for the election pursuant to of this provide the language to appear on the ballot b except for those issues which state law prescribes the language to appear on the ballot the ballot language shall consist of a title and the substance of the issue stated in the form of a question in clear and unambiguous language followed by the words yes and no and styled in such a manner that a yes vote will indicate approval of the proposal and a no vote will indicate rejection c if state law prescribes the specific language to appear on the ballot the ballot language shall be in substantially the form as provided in the applicable state law however should the state law not prescribe the ballot language the city attorney shall prepare the language consisting of a brief summation of the act not exceeding seventyfive 75 words in a question form and providing for a yes vote indicating approval of the act and a no vote indicating disapproval or rejection of the act d the ballot title shall consist of a caption not exceeding fifteen 15 words by which the measure is commonly referred e the substance of the issue shall be an explanatory statement of the primary purpose of the issue in the form of a question not exceeding seventyfive 75 words f if more than one 1 issue is to appear on the same ballot a consecutive designating number shall be assigned by the city clerk to each in the order of filing of the appropriate petition or other document required in order to be placed on the ballot or approval by city council of the the election referenda on special acts shall be separately designated g no later than thirty 30 days prior to the issue election the city clerk shall transmit to the supervisor of elections a certified copy of any an issue election together with the designating number if applicable the ballot title and substance of the issue  notice of election pursuant to fs   the city clerk shall cause a notice of election to be published in a newspaper of general circulation at least once during the fifth week and once in the third week preceding the week in which the election is held the notice shall be styled city of pinellas park notice of election and shall state the date of the election and issue to be voted upon the ballot language shall be included in the notice  issue ballot position any issue on a ballot also having candidates for elective office shall be placed in a position on the ballot so that it is separate and distinct from that portion of the ballot containing candidates names and shall be placed on the ballot either after or to the right of the candidates position on the ballot  appropriation of city funds for issue elections city council may appropriate funds for the purpose of providing informational materials to the public in connection resolution calling the election  article iv  election administration dates of elections a general elections pursuant to city charter the general election to fill the office of a city council member including mayor shall be held on the first tuesday of march b tie elections pursuant to cc604a city charter if in any election the returns as certified by the canvassing board result in a tie vote the election shall be decided by lot which shall mean that the name of each candidate who has tied shall be placed on a piece of paper which shall be placed in a container so that the candidates names are not visible a member of the canvassing board designated by the board shall then select one 1 piece of paper from the container the candidate whose name appears on that piece of paper shall be declared elected c vacancies pursuant to a city charter vacancies in the city council shall be filled by a majority vote of the remaining members of the city council any person so appointed to council to fill such vacancy shall hold office until the next regularly scheduled election if a regularly scheduled election is to be held within one 1 year from the date of the appointment  if no regularly scheduled election is to be held within that time city council must call a special election to fill the vacancy pursuant to b city charter in the event the remaining members of council shall fail to appoint a person to fill such vacancy and such failure shall continue for more than thirty 30 days after such vacancy was created such vacancy shall be filled by a special election called and held within one hundred twenty 120 days of such vacancy d issue elections issue elections shall be held on the date prescribed by applicable state law or resolution or the election      10252007 precincts a those
