florida statutes 1989 as amended  5122016 legislative findings and intent a all of the above recitals are incorporated herein and made a part hereof b the following statements are hereby adopted by reference as the legislative findings of the city council for the city which shall act as further justification and authority for the adoption of this   to that end the city council finds that 1 it is the purpose of this establish a concurrency management system that ensures that facilities and services needed to support land development are available concurrent with the impacts of such development the concurrency management system is intended to ensure that adopted levels of service standards for potable water sanitary sewer solid waste and drainage shall not be degraded below the levels adopted in the city of pinellas park comprehensive plan by the issuance of a development permit or order 2 the city desires to establish a concurrency management system which informs the citizens about infrastructure deficiencies creates reasonable options to mitigate such deficiencies and allows development to the extent necessary to prevent taking of property without just compensation 3 not all such development activity impacts are significant enough to cause the deterioration of the level of service as adopted in the city of pinellas park comprehensive plan it is therefore further found that a minimal development impact which alone or in combination with other impacts will not cause an unacceptable degradation of existing levels of service is consistent with the goals objectives and policies of the city of pinellas park comprehensive plan finally application of this methodology is found to be substantially related to the preservation of individual private property rights in accordance with the state comprehensive plan 4 that this adopted pursuant to the local government comprehensive planning and land development regulation act fs   et seq  5122016 definitions a acceptance of or accepted application for development means that an application for development containing required information pursuant to existing regulations to allow continuing review under this or other regulatory ordinances has been submitted to the city and accepted for processing b applicant means any person making an official request to the city for a development permit or development order as those terms are defined in this c application for development means a form approved by the city manager or his designee which requires at a minimum the following information 1 owners name address and telephone number 2 applicants name address and telephone number 3 type of development 4 legal description zoning classification and land use designation of development site 5 nearest public roads providing access to the property 6 number of residential units to be constructed or size of nonresidential development in square feet 7 other information as requested by staff together with any required accompanying documentation that is presented by any person for the purpose of obtaining a development order or development permit d approved final site plan means any site development plan as defined by the pinellas park land development that has been accepted reviewed and approved by the city of pinellas park e concurrency means that the necessary public facilities and services to maintain the adopted level of service standards are available when the impacts of development occur f concurrency management system means the procedure and process utilized by the city to determine that development orders and permits when issued will not result in an unacceptable degradation of the level of service standards adopted in the city of pinellas park comprehensive plan g concurrency management monitoring system means the data collection processing and analysis performed by pinellas park and other appropriate jurisdictions to determine levels of service for public facilities and services h concurrency test statement means a public facility and service status report prepared by the city manager or his designee i currently available revenue source means an existing source of revenue available to the city j development means the carrying out of any building activity the making of any material change in the use or appearance of any structure or land or the dividing of land into two 2 or more parcels 1 the following activities or uses shall be taken for the purposes of this involve development as defined in this a a reconstruction alteration of the size or material change in the external appearance of a structure or land b a change in the intensity of use of land such as an increase in the number of dwelling units in a structure or on land or a material increase in the number of businesses manufacturing establishments offices or dwelling units in a structure or on land c alteration of a shore or bank of a seacoast river stream lake pond or canal including any coastal construction as defined in fs   d deposit of refuse solid or liquid waste or fill on a parcel of land 2 the following operations or uses shall not be taken for the purpose of this involve development as defined in this a work by a highway or road agency or railroad company for the maintenance or improvement of a road or railroad track if the work is carried out on land within the boundaries of the rightofway b work by any utility and other persons engaged in the distribution or transmission of gas or water for the purpose of inspecting repairing renewing or constructing on established rightsofway any sewers mains pipes cables utility tunnels powerlines towers poles tracks or the like c work for the maintenance renewal improvement or alteration of any structure if the work affects only the interior or the color of the structure or the decoration of the exterior of the structure d the use of any structure or land devoted to dwelling uses for any purpose customarily incidental to enjoyment of the dwelling e the use of any land for the purpose of growing plants crops trees and other agricultural or forestry products  raising livestock  or for other agricultural purposes f a change in use of land or structure from a use within a class specified in an ordinance or rule to another use in the same class g a change in the ownership or form of ownership of any parcel or structure h the creation or termination of rights of access riparian rights easements covenants concerning development of land or other rights in land 3 development as designated herein includes all other development customarily associated with it unless otherwise specified when appropriate to the context development refers to the act of developing or to the result of development reference to any specific operation is not intended to mean that the operation or activity when part of other operations or activities are not development reference to particular operations is not intended to limit the generality of k development order means any order granting denying or granting with conditions an application for a development permit l development permit includes any building permit site plan approval conditional use issuance of new or changed business tax receipt or any other official action of local government having the effect of permitting the development of land tree removal permits and clearing and grubbing permits are not to be considered development permits m impact area means an area in which the level of service for a given facility or service which has been determined by data from the concurrency management monitoring system to be below the level of service identified and included in the city of pinellas park comprehensive plan n letter of concurrency means the official document issued by the city of pinellas park upon finding that an accepted application for development will not result in a reduction of the level of service standards set forth in the city of pinellas park comprehensive plan at a minimum the letter of concurrency shall provide the following information 1 type of development  and 2 development potential including maximum densities and intensities of use proposed  and 3 effective date of the concurrency test statement utilized in the comparison  and 4 date of issuance of the letter of concurrency  and 5 status of each public facility and service after the proposals impacts  and 6 mitigative measures where applicable which incorporate the provisions and measures necessary for development to proceed o level of service los means a measure of performance andor of demand versus available capacity of public services and facilities p local development order means for the purposes of this that last approval necessary to carry out the development requested provided that the proposed project has been precisely defined the last approval for a given type of development activity shall be as provided in the city of pinellas park land development as provided by such other applicable ordinances rules and regulations as adopted by the city q mitigate means for the purposes of this the elimination of all impacts of a proposed development which would further degrade to any extent the existing level of service for any of the four 4 public facilities or services identified herein r outparcel means any tract of parcel of land that is a part of a larger project under the same or different ownership s person shall include and be applied to individuals associations clubs societies firms partnerships copartnerships bodies politic and corporate and all other entities t public facilities and services means those necessary public facilities and services covered by a comprehensive plan element for which level of service standards have been adopted by the city the necessary public facilities and services are sanitary sewer solid waste drainage and potable water u remodeling as defined in the florida building means the changing of existing facilities by rearrangement of space andor change of use v renovations as defined in the florida building means the rejuvenating or upgrading of existing facilities by installation or replacement of materials and equipment the use and occupancy of the spaces remain the same w residential approval means a residential site plan or a final residential subdivision approval x unacceptable degradation or unacceptable level of service means that the level of service for any of the four 4 public facilities and services identified herein has been degraded below the acceptable level of service identified in and adopted by the city of pinellas park comprehensive plan  5122016 concurrency management systemprocedure a application for development the concurrency management system is accessed by the property owner or hisher representative when an application for development containing the required documentation for the given development order or permit is submitted to the city the city manager or his designee shall then ascertain the completeness of the documentation to verify that the information therein is sufficient to accept the application for development for review b application for development review 1 when the application for a development order or permit has been accepted it shall be processed and reviewed in accordance with established procedures these procedures shall include an initial review of the application for impacts of the proposed development for the four 4 public facilities and services identified in this as they may apply 2 if the application for development as submitted does not contain all required information then the application for development shall be returned to the property owner or his representative with a statement delineating the deficiencies c minimum concurrency criteria for potable water sanitary sewer drainage and solid waste the following are minimum standards which when met will satisfy the concurrency requirement 1 the necessary facilities and services are in place at the time a development order or permit is issued  or 2 a development order or permit is issued subject to the condition that the necessary facilities and services will be in place when the impacts of the development occur  or 3 the necessary facilities are under construction at the time a development order or permit is issued  or 4 at the time a development permit is issued the necessary facilities and services are subject of a binding executed contract to which the city is a party which provides for the commencement of the actual construction of the required facilities within one 1 year of the issuance of the development orderpermit  or 5 the necessary facilities are guaranteed in an enforceable development agreement acceptable to the city which requires the commencement of the facilities within one 1 year of the issuance of the applicable development orderpermit  or 6 the public facilities are required by the applicable capital improvements element to be constructed and completed when the impacts of development occur d concurrency test statement applied 1 after an application for development is accepted it will be reviewed and compared to the most recent concurrency test statement the impacts described in the application for development will be compared to the four 4 public facilities and services on the current concurrency test statement to determine the effect on the existing levels of service 2 if the most recent concurrency test statement shows the proposed development will fall within an area with an unacceptable level of service for one 1 or more of the four 4 public facilities or services identified herein a conditional letter of concurrency shall be issued authorizing the development only upon full compliance with appropriate specified provisions and measures as may be necessary to mitigate the impacts of development upon the deficient public facility or service in the event that there are no provisions or measures which can be imposed which will reasonably mitigate the impacts of the development upon the unacceptable level of service for any one 1 or more of the four 4 public facilities and services identified herein then the applicant will be issued a written statement denying a letter of concurrency 3 if the proposed development identified in the application for development being reviewed a has vested rights in accordance with of this   or b does not have impacts which will degrade any of the four 4 public facilities and services identified herein to an unacceptable level of service then a letter of concurrency shall be issued without provisions or measures attached as conditions e letter of concurrencyvalidity 1 the letter of concurrency shall be valid for purposes of obtaining development orders or permits for twelve 12 months from date of issuance 2 any development order or permit that is issued within the effective period of an existing letter of concurrency shall for purposes of concurrency only be vested in the event that a time extension is granted prior to the expiration of the approved development order or approved development permit then the letter of concurrency for the approved development shall be automatically renewed for the length of time of the extension 3 in the event that the development plan for a site changes relative to an increase in gross floor area or change in use within the effective period of an existing letter of concurrency the existing letter of concurrency will be reviewed for the incremental change the incremental change will require a complete review for impact upon the four 4 public facilities and services a concurrency determination will then be made for the incremental change 4 for those letter of concurrency issued for a development order issued by the city of pinellas park pursuant to the provisions of fs   as amended the duration of such letter of concurrency as issued shall be for the time period stated within the development order 5 the burden of showing compliance with concurrency standards and requirements shall be upon the applicant the applicant at his or her expense shall provide whatever documentation and information is necessary for the city to make a determination 6 the concurrency determination shall be made prior to the issuance of a development permit or order f development order or development permit compliance all development orders and development permits issued and approved after the effective date of this be based upon and be in compliance with the letter of concurrency issued for that development proposal a development order or development permit shall be deemed in compliance with its underlying letter of concurrency only if such development order or development permit is consistent therewith  5122016 concurrency test statement and monitoring system a on october 1 of each year the city manager or his designee shall establish an annual concurrency test statement which is consistent with the provisions of this b the city manager or his designee shall establish and maintain a concurrency management monitoring system for the purposes of monitoring the status of public facilities and services and for establishing concurrency test statements c the remaining capacity reported for each public facility and service on the annual concurrency test statement should be determined by using calculations from the concurrency management monitoring system data base for existing development and for committed development of multiyear phased development proposals or projects including developments of regional impact development orders etc these calculations are to be based upon an acceptable projection for the progress of each proposal or project population growth projections andor such other considerations as are consistent with sound planning principles and practices d nothing herein precludes the periodic establishment of amendments to the current concurrency test statement if updating or correction is deemed necessary for any reason including but not limited to the following errors in information are noted  the impact of issued development orders or permits as monitored by the city manager or his designee indicate an unacceptable degradation of an adopted level of service  or changes in the status of capital improvement projects impact the underlying assumptions of the current concurrency test statement e under no circumstances will an amended concurrency test statement divest those rights acquired pursuant to d under the concurrency test statement as it existed prior to amendment except where a divestiture of such rights is determined by the city manager or his designee to be essential to prevent injury to the health safety or welfare of the general public f in determining the availability of services or facilities the city of pinellas park shall approve if requested by the applicant developments in stages or phases so that facilities and services needed for each such phase or stage will be available in accordance with the standards required by c1 of this   infrastructure impact area a an impact area for potable water sanitary sewer drainage and solid waste shall include all lands all or any portion of which are located within the service area of such facility or service as set forth in the comprehensive plan b provisions and measures which may be attached to letters of concurrency that will apply in impact areas include but are not limited to the following 1 project phasing a project may be divided into logical phases of development by area with approval for certain phases of the development being withheld until the needed facilities are in place 2 an enforceable development agreement in a form acceptable to the city of pinellas park which may include but is not limited to development agreements pursuant to florida statutes 3 requirements that the necessary facilities be in place at the time the impacts of development occur any failure to comply with any such provisions or measures shall constitute a violation of the letter of concurrency upon a determination by the city of such a violation and upon written notice thereof to the applicant then the letter of concurrency and all related development permits shall be revoked c an applicant who wishes to appeal any or all provisions or measures imposed by the city of pinellas park pursuant to this file an appeal before the concurrency management panel the appeals procedure is set forth in of this  5122016 recognition of established levels of service the city of pinellas park shall recognize those adopted levels of service as defined in its comprehensive plan as stated below a drainage the concurrency management system will require that all applicable federal state and local regulations be adhered to by the applicant in drainage design including but not limited to chapters 40d4 and 40d40 fac  pinellas park land development   and the pinellas park drainage element the drainage the city of pinellas park florida dictates that new drainage systems including pipelines detentionretention basins and other appurtenances be sized on the basis of a twentyfiveyeartwentyfourhour storm for drainage basins greater than one 1 square mile and a tenyeartwentyfourhour storm for smaller basins these requirements correspond to a service level a development occurring in service area of existing drainage systems including pipelines detentionretention basin and other appurtenances shall comply with the applicable requirement of drainage the land development classification system based on four 4 levels of protection has been developed the flood level designations a b c and d correspond to the following service level a this is the most advanced level of service providing complete removal of water from streets during the designated rainfall event all stormwater is captured by the collection system eliminating street storage systems significant ponding does not occur and the health and safety concerns associated with minor flooding such as exposure to sewage transportation hazards and vehicular flooding are eliminated service level b this level of service allows some flooding of streets during the designated rainfall event with minor flooding of some yards but prevents significant levels of yard flooding the flooding occurs from the overland flow of offsite stormwater surcharging the collection system and ponding in confined areas the primary impacts of this service level are nuisance flooding of streets making them temporarily impassable flooding is of a limited duration major roadways may have some standing water in some lanes but travel in the lanes is not restricted yard flooding is limited to areas away from structures service level c this is the minimum level of service that provides protection from flooding of structures flooding is caused by surcharging stormwater systems with runoff and ponding in low lying areas minor streets may be impassable for periods of time and major roads have reduced travel ability due to flood related lane closure yards are flooded up to the face of the structure however no inundation of structures occurs service level d major flooding is caused by the inability of storm drainage systems to remove run off under this level of service streets yards and structures all receive some level of flood damage and some major traffic arteries become impassable evacuation of some areas for health reasons may be necessary it should be noted that these levels of service only refer to the performance of drainage systems flooding caused by streams topping their banks due to abnormal influences such as ditch blockages or tidal surges are not addressed the level of service standard must be related to a designated rainfall frequency event such as a twentyfiveyeartwentyfourhour storm b solid waste and resource recovery the concurrency management system will utilize disposal of one and threetenths 130 tons of solid waste per person per year and maintenance of twice weekly garbage pick up and once weekly recycling pick up for residential accounts and on an as needed basis for commercial accounts c water supply for water supply the concurrency management system will recognize the criteria associated with the agreement between pinellas county county and the city of pinellas park city wherein the county agrees to furnish the city up to five million 5000000 gallons per day mgd yearly average of water for its use and redistribution in its water service area the pinellas park comprehensive plan has identified the impact of development upon the potable water system for residential uses as sixty 60 gallonspersonday and nonresidential uses as thirty 30 gallons per day per employee as identified in the pinellas county comprehensive plan assurances are given whereby the pinellas county water demand planning area will provide a level of service of one hundred twenty 120 gallons per capita per day gpcpd on an annual average d sanitary sewer the concurrency management system will recognize the agreement for wastewater transmission treatment and disposal services between pinellas county county and the city of pinellas park city the county treats city wastewater at its south cross bayou plant which has a twentytwo 22 mgd average daily flow subject to a capacity of thirtythree 33 mgd the pinellas park comprehensive plan has identified the impact of residential development upon the wastewater system as one hundred 100 gallonsdayperson and nonresidential development as one thousand 1000 gallons per day per acre  5122016 intergovernmental coordination a the city as the provider of public facilities or services to development within other governmental jurisdictions shall provide such facilities or services in accordance with the policies included in its comprehensive plan b development within the city which receives public facilities or services from other governmental entities shall recognize the level of service established by such entities in accordance with the policies of the city of pinellas park comprehensive plan  5122016 concurrency management panel a there is hereby established a city of pinellas park concurrency management panel which shall consist of the regular members of the board of adjustment upon the request of the chairperson of the concurrency management panel an alternate member of the board of adjustment shall act in place of a regular member who is temporarily absent and when acting shall have the full power of a regular member b hearings before the concurrency management panel shall be conducted in the following manner 1 the applicant shall present such evidence as he or she may wish to offer in support of his or her position one 1 or more full time city employees designated by the city manager shall then present evidence in opposition 2 the parties may then offer rebuttal evidence 3 the panel members shall have the right of query after each witness or at any other time any panel member deems it necessary and any panel member may examine and ask questions about any other evidence offered 4 after such rebuttal the parties may present closing arguments after which presentations shall cease and the panel shall analyze the evidence so presented 5 after such analysis the panel shall render a judgment within the time frame set forth in this concurrency management panel shall adopt such additional rules as it deems necessary and proper to the conduct of its affairs meetings shall be held at the call of the chairperson and at such times as the concurrency management panel may determine c the zoning division shall receive file and transmit to the concurrency management panel all appeals applications vested rights determinations and other matters on which the concurrency management panel is authorized to act under the provisions of this  5122016 vested rights a vested developments the following proposed developments shall be exempt from the requirements of the concurrency management system but not other applicable requirements for the time limits specified herein 1 each phase within a phased development which has been authorized pursuant to an approved final site plan and an approved construction schedule shall remain vested for the period of time established in the approved construction schedule in the event that the applicant fails to complete the development of any phase as required thereby then that phase and all subsequent phases shall no longer be vested 2 a development order for a development of regional impact which has been issued on or before  shall remain vested for the period of time specified in the original development order 3 an annexation agreement in effect on or before  which by its express terms and not by implication shall provide vested rights for the development of the parcel which is the subject thereof as specified therein such rights shall remain vested for the period of time specified in the annexation agreement b rights vested by the doctrine of equitable estoppel a proposed development may proceed even if deemed inconsistent with the city of pinellas park comprehensive plan if the city finds determination as described below that the owner or his representative has proven that 1 he or she acted in good faith and in reasonable reliance  2 upon some act of the city  and 3 has made such a substantial change in position or has incurred such extensive obligations and expenses that it would be highly inequitable or unjust to destroy the rights he or she has acquired c vested rights determination process 1 any applicant may simultaneously with the submission of his or her application submit a written request to the city manager or his designee for a determination as to vested rights status of the proposed development under paragraphs a or b of this written request shall be accompanied by any information and documentation which may be required by the city manager or his designee if additional information and documentation is necessary for this purpose the city manager or his designee may thereafter require the applicant to submit the same the city manager or his designee shall within fortyfive 45 days from the receipt of the written request for a determination of vested rights status from the developer issue a written determination to the applicant 2 any applicant who requests a vested rights determination by the concurrency management panel under shall do so in writing within thirty 30 days of issuance of written notification from staff that the development is not entitled to vested rights status requests must include a thorough description of the property or project which is the subject of the application and the documents andor a summary of the testimony which the applicant maintains will establish such vested rights each filing must be accompanied by an application fee in the amount of two hundred fifty dollars $25000 3 the vested rights determination shall be made at a hearing conducted by the concurrency management panel the concurrency management panel may request technical or other informationassistance from the applicant or various city departments during the determination process the concurrency management panel shall rely on florida law to determine whether an applicant has established an entitlement to vested rights status if authorized by the city the concurrency management panel may request the appearance of independent consultants andor expert witnesses the concurrency management panel may request the appearance of appropriate city staff at the vested rights determination hearing 4 vested rights determination hearings shall be held within ninety 90 days of the date the request is filed with the zoning division and notice of such hearing shall be sent to the applicant within five 5 days of the hearing if necessary by a majority vote of the panel the panel may continue any petition or case before it to a subsequent hearing 5 within twentyone 21 days after the applicants vested rights determination hearing the city shall make available to the public and to the applicant in writing the decision of the concurrency management panel such decision shall be released zoning division and shall constitute final governmental action judicial review of any decision of the concurrency management panel shall be by certiorari in the circuit court of pinellas county florida 6 in order for the applicant to overturn in whole or in part the denial of vested rights by staff the applicant must prove by a preponderance of the evidence that there was no substantial competent evidence to support the denial of vested rights 7 the zoning division shall maintain as required by law the records of all concurrency management panel proceedings relating to vested rights determinations 8 before any aggrieved person may challenge a decision determination or result made under this a temporary or permanent taking of private property without just compensation he or she must exhaust the provisions of this any other applicable subsequently enacted administrative procedures before any action on a request for development is deemed to be final  5122016 appeals a appeals procedure 1 any applicant who has been denied a development order or permit or is subject to specific provisions or city council of the city of pinellas park florida makes the following findings with respect to the pinellas park community redevelopment plan a the board of county commissioners of pinellas county the county pursuant to resolution no 88649 adopted  delegated certain powers to the city council of the city of pinellas park in order to carry out certain redevelopment functions within the city including the pinellas park community redevelopment area the redevelopment area b the city council of the city of pinellas park the city pursuant to resolution no 887 declared the existence of one 1 or more slum and blighted areas within the city of pinellas park and thereby established a redevelopment area c the pinellas park community redevelopment plan which is on file with the city clerks office has been developed as a community redevelopment plan for a portion of pinellas park the redevelopment area pursuant to part iii of of the florida statutes 1990 the boundaries of the redevelopment area and a legal description of the redevelopment area are on file with the city clerks office d the pinellas park community redevelopment plan will afford maximum opportunity consistent with the sound needs of the municipality as a whole for the rehabilitation or redevelopment of the redevelopment area by private enterprise e the pinellas park community redevelopment plan conforms to the general plan of the municipality as a whole f the pinellas park community redevelopment plan gives due consideration to the provision of adequate park and recreational areas and facilities that may be desirable for neighborhood improvement with special consideration for the health safety and welfare of children residing in the general vicinity of the site covered by the plan g a feasible method exists for the relocation of families that will be displaced from the redevelopment area in decent safe and sanitary dwelling accommodations within their means and without undue hardship to such families  4122012 adoption of plan the pinellas park community redevelopment plan which is on file with the city clerks office is hereby approved and adopted by the city council of pinellas park as the community redevelopment plan for the redevelopment area  4122012 findings redevelopment trust fund the city council of the city of pinellas park florida makes the following findings with respect to the pinellas park redevelopment trust fund a the board of county commissioners of pinellas county the county pursuant to resolution no 88469 adopted  delegated certain powers to the city council of the city of pinellas park in order to carry out certain redevelopment functions within the city including the pinellas park community redevelopment area the redevelopment area b the city within the city of pinellas park and thereby established a redevelopment area c the city has approved and adopted pursuant to a community redevelopment plan the pinellas park community redevelopment plan for the redevelopment area  4122012 redevelopment trust fund there is hereby established and created in accordance with the provisions of florida statute 1990 a redevelopment trust fund trust fund  4122012   use of trust funds the funds allocated to and deposited into the trust fund are hereby appropriated to the pinellas park community redevelopment agency to finance or refinance for the duration of the pinellas park community redevelopment plan the community redevelopment projects within the redevelopment area of the city of pinellas park the pinellas park community redevelopment agency shall utilize the funds and revenues paid into and earned by the trust fund for any community redevelopment purpose delegated to it and as contained in the pinellas park community redevelopment plan for redevelopment and as provided by law  4122012   financing of trust funds a each taxing authority shall pay into the trust fund an amount not less than the increment in the income proceeds revenues and funds of each taxing authority derived from or held in connection with the redevelopment area and the pinellas park community redevelopment agencys undertaking and carrying out of the community redevelopment projects therein said increments shall be determined and appropriated annually and shall be that amount equal to ninetyfive 95 percent of the difference between 1 the amount of ad valorem taxes levied each year by each taxing authority exclusive of any amount from any debt service millage on taxable real property contained within the geographic boundaries of the redevelopment area  and 2 the amount of ad valorem taxes which would have been produced by the rate upon which the taxes levied each year by or for each taxing authority exclusive of any debt service millage upon the total of the assessed value of the taxable property in the redevelopment area as shown upon the most recent assessment roll used in connection with the taxation of such property by each taxing authority prior to  in calculating the increment the amount of the ad valorem taxes levied based on the citywide debt service on city bonds shall be totally excluded from the calculation and shall continue to be used for their voter approved purpose and shall not be appropriated to the trust fund any adjustments made in the appropriation will be based upon the final extended tax roll b each taxing authority shall annually pay to the trust fund the tax increment as herein defined due the trust by january 1 of each year any taxing authority which does not pay the increment to the trust fund by january 1 shall pay to the trust fund an additional amount equal to five percent 5% of the amount of the increment and shall also pay interest on the amount of the increment equal to one percent 1% for each month the increment is outstanding c as used herein taxing authority shall have the same meaning as that contained in florida statute   as amended from time to time  4122012   administration of trust funds the pinellas park community redevelopment agency is directed to set up the trust fund and to develop and promulgate rules regulations and criteria whereby the trust fund may be promptly and effectively administered including the establishment and the maintenance of books and records and the adoption of procedures whereby the pinellas park community redevelopment agency may expeditiously and without undue delay utilize said funds for the allocated statutory purposes and for the purposes identified herein the pinellas park community redevelopment agency is hereby vested with full responsibility for the receipt custody disbursement accountability management and proper application of all monies paid into the trust fund copies of all reports of audits required by 8 florida statute 1990 and other applicable provisions of law shall be provided to the city council and to pinellas county each fiscal year  4122012 severability this article and the pinellas park community redevelopment plan which is on file with the city clerks office having been adopted for a public purpose and for the welfare of the citizens of the city of pinellas park florida shall be liberally construed considered severable and the invalidity of any section clause or provision of this the plan shall not affect the validity of any other section clause or provision of this plan  4122012 community redevelopment agency administration and procedures a community redevelopment agency in addition to those powers and duties set forth under florida statutes as delegated community redevelopment agency these regulations shall apply to and be limited to all property located within the community redevelopment area zoned or proposed to be rezoned to mxd mixed use district circumstances necessitating such time extension and the applicable fee b an application for a time extension shall be filed no later than thirtyfive 35 days prior to the expiration date of the conditional use variance or approved site plan c the community development administrator or a designee may approve approve with additional conditions or deny a request for time extension the community development administrator or a designee shall review the previously approved conditional use variance or approved site plan the conditions and safeguards imposed in connection with its prior approval and make a determination on whether the conditional use variance or site plan approval still satisfies the applicable conditional use variance or site plan approval requirements and other land development additionally all regulations in effect at the time the application for the time extension are considered by the community development administrator or a designee shall apply and be considered in deciding the request for time extension d an applicant whose time extension has been approved with additional conditions where such additional conditions are felt unwarranted or present a hardship or whose time extension has been denied may appeal such decision of the community development administrator or designee to the community redevelopment agency an appeal shall be filed with the zoning division within a reasonable time not to exceed sixty 60 days of the date of the community development administrators or designees decision paying the fee as required by the applicable fee schedule such appeal shall specify the grounds therefore 2 appeals of community redevelopment agency decisions the city applicant or property owner or property owners within three hundred 300 feet of
